result.execSummary:
On one or more charges in this case, Charles F. Weissmiller was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Judge Wolf and reporter  appears by video conference. Prosecutor, Lyndsey A.B. Brunette, and Defendant, Charles F. Weissmiller, appeared with Attorney Paul M Fredrickson. Court finds defendant to be committed to institutionalized care with placement to be determined by DHHS which in this case is Mendota Mental Health. Judge Wolf and Court Reporter appeared by telephone;   District Attorney Lyndsey A Boon Brunette appeared on behalf of the State;  Defendant appeared in person with Attorney Fredrickson. Court found that that defendant is to be committed for 18 months with institutionalized placement at Trempealeau County Health Care Center. Further defendant will be under an involuntary Psychotropic medication/treatment order and is to make a reasonable good faith effort to repay Andrew Shadde the vet bills of $2112.93. Additionally, defendant is not to possess any pets or animals.

Sentencing hearing on March 17, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Richard Lewis appeared for the State;  Defendant appeared in person with Attorney Fredrickson. Defendant enters a plea of guilty, and is found guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. Court orders the defendant committed to DHSS as of 2-11-2015 and orders a Predisposition Investigation by DHSS.
